description: Decimal expansion of (-1)*Gamma'(1/4)/Gamma(1/4) where Gamma(x) denotes the Gamma function.
references: S.J. Patterson, "An introduction to the theory of the Riemann zeta function", Cambridge studies in advanced mathematics no. 14, p. 135
formula: Gamma'(1/4)/Gamma(1/4) = -EulerGamma - 3*log(2) - Pi/2 where EulerGamma is the Euler-Mascheroni constant (A001620).
mathematica: EulerGamma + Pi/2 + Log[8] // RealDigits[#, 10, 105][[1]] & (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jun 18 2013 *)
author: _Benoit Cloitre_, May 24 2003
